div.h1:
South Putnam Community School Corporation
Successful Tradition – Innovative Future

div.style: position: absolute; left: 0px; top: 0px; z-index: 100001; background-color: rgb(170, 170, 170); opacity: 0.5; display: none;

strong.span: See below for COVID-19 related school update.

div.h2: Welcome to South Putnam Community School Corporation

p.span: South Putnam Community School corporation is located in south-central Putnam County. The corporation covers an area of 163 square miles and is crossed by Interstate 70 and U.S. Highway 40 to the east and west, and U.S. Highway 231 to the north and south. South Putnam has approximately 1,150 students in Pre-Kindergarten through 12th grade among three buildings including South Putnam Middle School/ High School, Central Elementary and Fillmore Elementary. South Putnam is committed to equipping students for professional and personal success by guiding students to excellence according the Indiana State Standards and the five C's: communication, collaboration, creativity, critical thinking and character.

div.div: Governor Eric Holcomb announced Indiana schools will be closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. SPCSC will be using some Home Learning Days in April and May to continue learning for our students. That schedule is reflected in our Spring 2020 Learning Plan Calendar. Grab-and-go breakfasts and lunches will be available for weekly pick up for students through the end of the learning calendar. Click on this article for more details and links to information.
div.a: Read More about 4/03/20 COVID-19 Related School Update

div.div: The Indiana Department of Labor has temporarily suspended the requirement for employers to have on file work permits for 16 and 17 year-olds effective beginning Monday, March 16. Information is posted at https://www.in.gov/dol/.
div.a: Read More about Work Permits - Temporary Policy

div.div: We will be distributing breakfast and lunch grab-and-go meals to SPCSC students each Monday from 8:30 to 11:30 a.m. at South Putnam High School (door 9) and Fillmore Elementary (front entrance) beginning March 30th. Parents/guardians or student drivers may pick up meals for the week. These pick-ups will be conducted drive-thru style. Families wanting meals should complete the Meal Request Form by clicking "Read More" and clicking the link in the article. All grab-and-go meals are free for all South Putnam School Corporation enrolled students. Additional dates will be added as needed. If you have questions please contact Lori Boyce at lboyce@sputnam.k12.in.us. This institution is an Equal Opportunity Provider.
div.a: Read More about Spring 2020 Student Food Request Form

div.p: South Putnam Community School Corporation does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability in admission to its programs, services, or activities, in access to them, in treatment of individuals, or in any aspect of their operations. The lack of English language skills shall not be a barrier to admission or participation in the district's activities and programs. South Putnam Community School Corporation also does not discriminate in its hiring or employment practices.
